Prerequisites: ACG3024 FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS FOR MANAGERS
Course Description: THIS COURSE COVERS PLANNING, CONTROL AND ANALYSIS OF PRODUCTION, ADMINISTRATIVE AND SELLING COSTS USING BUDGETING AND STANDARD COST ACCOUNTING TECHNIQUES INCLUDING VARIANCE ANALYSIS, INVENTORY MANAGEMENT, ACTIVITY-BASED COSTING, CAPITAL BUDGETING, AND STRATEGIC PLANNING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.	DESCRIBE THE COST CONCEPTS, COST BEHAVIORS AND COST ACCOUNTING TECHNIQUES THAT ARE APPLIED TO MANUFACTURING AND SERVICE BUSINESSES.
2.	APPLY COST CONCEPTS AND COST BEHAVIORS IN THE SOLVING OF MANAGEMENT DECISION.
3.	DETERMINE THE COSTS OF PRODUCTS AND SERVICES.
4.	ANALYZE THE PROFITABILITY OF A PRODUCT OR SERVICE.
5.	DISCUSS THE VARIOUS TECHNIQUES AVAILABLE TO MEASURE MANAGERIAL PERFORMANCE AND TO MOTIVATE EMPLOYEES TOWARD ORGANIZATIONAL GOALS.
